evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Continuous data will be summarized using descriptive statistics: the number of observations (n), mean, standard deviation, minimum, median and maximum
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: The term “descriptive statistics” refers to the number of patients (n), mean, median, standard deviation (SD), minimum, and maximum for continuous variables
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Continuous variables will be summarized by reporting the number of observations (n), mean, standard deviation, median, minimum, and maximum.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Chain-of-thought: 1) Original SAP lists n, mean, SD, min, median, max. 2) Generated SAP lists the same. 3) They match.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: The baseline value for all analyses will be the last non-missing value prior to the first infusion unless otherwise specified.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Baseline Value: Defined as the last non-missing observation (including central laboratory results, vital signs, and tumor assessments) recorded prior to the First Dose Date.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Response will be calculated in comparison to the baseline tumor measurements obtained before starting study treatment.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Chain-of-thought: 1) Original SAP defines baseline as last non-missing prior to first infusion. 2) Generated SAP defines it as last non-missing prior to First Dose Date. 3) These are semantically equivalent.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Patients who received incorrect treatment during the Induction Study Period will be excluded from the PK population.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: If any patients are found to be non-compliant with respect to dosing, a decision will be made on a case-by-case basis at the blinded data review meeting before unblinding.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: If any patients are found to be non-compliant with respect to dosing, a decision will be made on a case-by-case basis at the blinded data review meeting before unblinding.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Chain-of-thought: 1) Original SAP adds a specific exclusion rule for incorrect treatment. 2) Generated SAP uses broader 'case-by-case' language. 3) Generated SAP matches the Protocol text exactly. 4) Therefore, Generated SAP is correct.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Patients receiving at least one dose of CT-P16 will be analyzed under the CT-P16 treatment group. All other patients will be analyzed under the EU-Approved Avastin treatment group.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Patients will be assigned to treatment groups based on treatment actually received.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Patients will be assigned to treatment groups based on treatment actually received.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Chain-of-thought: 1) Original SAP specifies the 'as-treated' logic in detail. 2) Generated SAP states 'based on treatment actually received'. 3) This is the standard definition of Safety Population and matches the intent.

missing_information.original_sap_text: Minimum and maximum will be presented to the same number of decimal places as the raw data, mean and median will be presented to one more decimal place than the raw data, and standard deviation will be presented to two more decimal places than the raw data.
missing_information.note: Generated SAP lacks specific rounding rules found in Original SAP.
missing_information.reasoning: Chain-of-thought: 1) Found in Original SAP Section 4. 2) Not found in Generated SAP Section 4.1. 3) Protocol does not specify rounding rules. 4) Missing Original SAP-only content.

missing_information.original_sap_text: In order to evaluate the impact of missing data on the primary efficacy endpoint results, additional analyses with tipping point analyses will be conducted for the primary efficacy endpoint (central review data) for ITT population.
missing_information.note: Original SAP includes Tipping Point Analysis for missing data; Generated SAP includes Complete Case Analysis instead.
missing_information.reasoning: Chain-of-thought: 1) Found in Original SAP Section 4.9. 2) Generated SAP Section 6.1.1.4 lists sensitivity analyses but omits Tipping Point. 3) Protocol Section 7.6.1 mentions covariates but not specific missing data sensitivity analyses like Tipping Point. 4) Missing Original SAP-only content.

missing_information.original_sap_text: Additionally, if any case of major protocol deviation related to COVID-19 is identified during the DRM, primary analysis will be performed excluding patients with major protocol deviation related to COVID-19 in ITT population as supportive analysis
missing_information.note: Original SAP includes specific COVID-19 logic likely added during the study; Generated SAP (and Protocol) do not.
missing_information.reasoning: Chain-of-thought: 1) Found in Original SAP Section 4.6. 2) Not found in Generated SAP. 3) Protocol is from 2019 (pre-COVID impact). 4) Missing Original SAP-only content.

missing_information.original_sap_text: Major protocol deviations include the following: Mis-randomizations... Non-compliance of Inclusion or Exclusion criteria... Significant Good Clinical Practice (GCP) non-compliance... Receiving any prohibited therapies... Missing primary efficacy assessment
missing_information.note: Original SAP defines specific major deviations; Generated SAP defers definition to the SAP (circular reference) or omits the list.
missing_information.reasoning: Chain-of-thought: 1) Found in Original SAP Section 4.6. 2) Generated SAP Section 3.3 mentions deviations will be defined in the SAP but does not list them. 3) Protocol Section 7.4 says deviations will be defined in the SAP. 4) Missing Original SAP-only content.

missing_information.original_sap_text: For the purpose of summarization, any numeric values recorded below the lower limit or above the upper limit of quantification will be set to the respective limit for all related summaries unless otherwise indicated.
missing_information.note: Specific data handling rule for quantification limits is missing.
missing_information.reasoning: Chain-of-thought: 1) Found in Original SAP Section 4. 2) Not found in Generated SAP General Methodology. 3) Protocol does not specify. 4) Missing Original SAP-only content.

missing_information.original_sap_text: When combining data from eCRF and analytical facilities discrepancy will be handled as following: 1. Recorded as collected sample in eCRF but no corresponding results... 2. No corresponding records in eCRF... 3. Discrepancy in sample collection date...
missing_information.note: Detailed data cleaning/handling rules are missing.
missing_information.reasoning: Chain-of-thought: 1) Found in Original SAP Section 4. 2) Not found in Generated SAP. 3) Protocol does not specify. 4) Missing Original SAP-only content.

extra_information_flagged.generated_sap_text: All analyses described in this plan will be performed using SAS v9.4 or higher unless specified otherwise.
extra_information_flagged.detail: Original SAP text for software section is empty/missing in provided document; Generated SAP specifies SAS.
extra_information_flagged.reasoning: Chain-of-thought: 1) Generated SAP specifies SAS v9.4. 2) Original SAP Section 4.1 header exists but text is absent. 3) Standard practice, no contradiction.

extra_information_flagged.generated_sap_text: The following windows apply to assessments scheduled every cycle... Cycle 2 | 22 | 2 – < 33...
extra_information_flagged.detail: Generated SAP provides explicit visit window tables not found in Original SAP General Methodology section.
extra_information_flagged.reasoning: Chain-of-thought: 1) Generated SAP Section 4.5 includes detailed tables. 2) Original SAP does not have these in Section 4. 3) They align with Protocol schedule (every 3 weeks). 4) Beneficial extra detail.

extra_information_flagged.generated_sap_text: Study Day 1: Defined as the First Dose Date... Duration of Treatment: Calculated as (Last Dose Date – First Dose Date) + 1.
extra_information_flagged.detail: Generated SAP explicitly defines derived variables for study days and durations.
extra_information_flagged.reasoning: Chain-of-thought: 1) Generated SAP Section 4.2 defines these variables. 2) Original SAP uses them but does not explicitly define the formulas in Section 4. 3) Standard definitions, no contradiction.

reasoning: Step-by-step chain-of-thought reasoning trace: 1) I compared the General Methodology sections of the Original and Generated SAPs. 2) The Generated SAP covers the core requirements (populations, descriptive statistics, baseline definitions) accurately. 3) The Generated SAP matches the Protocol where it differs from the Original SAP (e.g., PK population exclusion criteria). 4) There are several items present in the Original SAP that are missing from the Generated SAP, including decimal precision rules, tipping point analysis, and COVID-19 handling. 5) None of these missing items are required by the Protocol (Protocol defers to SAP or is silent). 6) According to the instructions, missing Original SAP-only content does not lower the rating. 7) There are no contradictions. 8) Therefore, the rating is GREAT.
summary: The Generated SAP accurately reflects the general methodology outlined in the Protocol and aligns well with the Original SAP's core definitions. While it omits some specific data handling rules (e.g., decimal precision, tipping point analysis) present in the Original SAP, these are not Protocol requirements. The Generated SAP provides additional useful details on visit windows and derived variables.
